百合大法好
    发售后看见就入了，毕竟百合，我好兴奋。历时十个小时后也总算全成就了，自己第一次玩朔夜线BE...差点丧失继续玩下去的信心。
    总的来说线路不算长，剧情还是比较饱满的，不过所有线的BE都是...高虐，在此不做剧透，请自行食用，都不知道怎么形容；AFTER SCHOOL结局让我一头雾水的感觉，一汐线和老师线略赶，还有就是一些地方感觉比较牵强，但是游戏嘛，玩的开心就好，这种地方忽略就可以了。人设没什么好说的，鲜明丰满，尤其是朔夜。立绘画风方面应该可以说是本作最大亮点，更是没挑的，相比之UI简直丑的不忍直视；官方自带中文，而且非机翻，好评，有几处翻译的小失误，不过没有什么影响。

+ 不错的剧情，优秀的人设
+ 立绘美
+ CV很棒

- 界面实在不好看...而且不可以调整分辨率
- BGM并不好听，有几处感觉是在...用的不恰当

个人评分 8/10 喜欢百合请直接买

一下是全结局攻略以及附带的一点点剧透
[spoiler]1 1 1 1 2 1 1 1（此处说出秘密要连续选择三次1，若选2则只用一次，但之后可能无法进入老师线） 2 2 此处得到存档一 2 2 此处得到存档二 1 此处得到存档三
    妹线 存档三处开始1 1 2 1 1 2 1此处请存档，之后1为BE，2为GE，说实话BE的捆绑设定简直不要太刺激，某只意义上也不算BE呢（痴汉脸）
    朔夜线 存档三处开始2 1 1 2 1 1此处请存档，之后1为GE，2为BE，个人最喜欢的GE，一家三口百合美美美！！！BE就有一点点虐了，和尸体结婚什么的...其实已经黑化了吧
    老师线存档二处开始2 1 4 1 2 1 2此处请存档，之后1为GE，2为BE，老师线剧情没什么大的起伏，所以也没什么感觉，完全萌不起来，BE明日香离黑化也不远了
    一汐线存档一处开始1 1 1 3 2 1 2 2此处请存档，之后1为BE，2为GE，GE最不喜欢的一条线了，剧情也应该是所有中最差的，BE则是所以BE最变态的，刚开始没意识到这BAD在哪，之后再告诉你其实一汐死了，明日香把她冰起来一天吃一顿...简直了，来自官方的恶意，恶心的我不要不要的
    AFTER SCHOOL结局存档三处开始4 1最短的一条线，不过也算是细思极恐
    存档一之前的一些选择对总体剧情没影响，只有一些小对话上的改动，进入人物线后同理，不过有几个选项选错直接进BE，所以想看另一选项的对话请先存档，总的来说很简单，在选的时候立好FLAG就行，善用CTRL以及直接前往下一选项，推荐自己玩了之后在进行全结局收集[spoiler]

24291971.review:
Nurse Love Additiction is a lot of fun. The game starts out as a cute yuri adventure but has some twists and turns along the way - I felt that the second half was a lot darker, and it definitely changed how I interacted with the game. I was on edge, in a good way, kind of like I was in a mystery novel. Not that cute yuri stuff ever goes away, the game just has more depth than that.

MILD SPOILERS

The heroines available are really interesting to me - your blood related sister, two class mates already in a relationship and a teacher. None of these are the typical, pure flower heroines I come to expect from VNs. I'm the type that definitely appreciates this break from more normal, "safe" heroine archetypes.

END SPOILERS

The game is made for widescreen and controls great with just the mouse. No obscure keyboard short cuts. Text is nice and big, easily readable. Game is fully voiced. Overall I was really happy with the game's presentation, as well as its story. I've only done one route, I'll probably do another, not sure if I'll do all of them, I rarely 100% VNs, but I feel this is worth the price tag.

All in all, very happy with this, would buy another yuri visual novel from the same developer in a heart beat. :D

24221960.review:
So I've never reviewed a game or VN as of yet on Steam, but I can't think of a better one to make my first. The fact that this was going to explore Yuri romance was all I really needed to be interested in this VN and the previews, description and nursing school setting was adequate enough to make me want to buy it. The price may seem a bit much, but trust me when I say, it's worth every penny. However, since you don't know me enough to just take my word for it, allow me to clarify. Before I get into it, I will echo what I feel can be the game's tagline, "It's Not as it Seems." It's a bit long, but I think it'd be worth reading thoroughly. Please also be aware that this is  just my opinion and may differ from others.

Just as the description says, this VN ultimately tells the story of an aspiring nurse named Asuka, who begins her first year of Nursing school with her sister. Early on, she meets two fellow classmates and her teacher, all three of which she comes to form bonds with over her 3 years of school. The nature of those bonds is where you come in. The game offers several choices throughout the story and what you choose WILL determine future options and situations, so it requires careful selection. Even the smallest of decisions may very well shape if you can achieve a good or bad end or any end at all. Each girl has their respective Good and Bad end and then there's a premature end that will have the game end before it's time and leave you unsatisfied. Careful selection is crucial to avoid this ending. Now for more specific review ratings.

Plot: 10/10

The plot mentioned above is only the start of what this game actually has to offer. The true story and it's progression will be something you'll never see coming and will shock you, I assure you. This is coming from someone who's not easily caught by surprise and can usually predict plots pretty easily. It also had some touching and bittersweet moments, integral in any good romance. The main plot is one big picture, but each girl's route contributes the minor details of it to make that big picture take shape. Each girl plays a role in a particular way, each offering new and important information to the main story. This means that to get the full story as the writer I'm sure wished for it to be received, will require successfully completing the route of every girl, but it's so worth it.

Characters: 9/10

The characters were all very well designed and developed, as were their individual stories and routes. They all had their quirks and particular charm, that I feel would be hard to find disagreeable overall and so it's quite easy and enoyable to play through all the routes without getting bored or feeling like it's a hassle. The only reason it didn't get a 10 was because there were some routes that I felt could have been elaborated on just a tad bit more so that we could learn more on their backgrounds, but it was still sufficient to not feel rushed or lacking to an extreme degree.

Yuri: 10/10

This is the most important aspect for most I'm sure and so I can assure you it doesn't disappoint in that department. The romantic developments, interactions and events are all very well developed, enjoyable and satisfying. Each girl offers a unique relationship type for Asuka, as they all are unique in their expressions of love and personalties. I found myself in love with each pair for different reasons and never disappointed with any of them. The good endings were obviously best for each girl, but the bad endings had their own sort of charm too, which was also quite enjoyable.  In regards to the pairings, any route is open to be seen as the true route, but as it might be epected as you delve deeper into the plot, I'd say that Sakuya's route may be the canon "true" route, only my opinion though, and so you may want to save that one for last, but then again, the  beauty of this game is that you can play any route, in any order order you'd like...as long as you choose wisely!

Medical Accuracy: 10/10

If a game is going to make a specific subect a main aspect of a story, then the accuracy of it should be assesed right? Well as a second year medical student, although a bit different from nursing, I can say that all the medical knowledge and references they portray in the game are quite accurate and complete. So much so, that I found myself very impressed and this aspect also allowed me to enjoy the game that much more because I could relate to some of the things they covered. It's all done in a very natural way, never overshadowing the romance nor being too comple or advanced for non-medical players to understand. This, in my opinion, is another thing that made this game unique.


Overall: 10/10

I can't say I have years of experience in playing VNs, but playing this one has certainly encouraged me to try even more in both the yuri and otherwise genres. I had so much fun playing through this VN and experimenting with my choices, mapping out the routes and figuring out my mistakes. It's similar to a puzzle, where each piece has to fit just right to make the story whole and reach the end you're looking for, but once you get there, the sense of accomplishment is such a wonderful feeling. Just one final word of advice I have to give you is this, save at EVERY selection point. It will make your life so much easier when you inevitabley make a wrong choice and get the premature or bad end. It makes it simpler to backtrack and try a different option and get to where you wanted to go. Of course there are skip functions, but it's much easier if you can just load up at the spot you know you probably need to change rather than skipping through from the start. The game took me 20 hours to achieve every route, both good and bad, while taking the time to read the new text each time I reached a new path. I'm a fast reader and it took me this long, so if you play this game the correct way and don't speed read beyond reason and actually listen to the dialogue, you shouldn't finish to completion in less than 15-20 hours, leaning more towards 20 in my opinion. At most I'd say it may take slower readers, or those who may not be as quick to catch their mistakes, up to 30 hours. 

So my point in saying this and the bottom line is this...for a game that offers a very unique, thorough, medically competent, complex, enjoyable, yuri romance story that takes you many hours to complete and has a great plot twist, is worth $40. Not even including the limitless times you'll have to replay your favorite routes and relive the story. So I can highly recommend this game and if you're a yuri romance and mystery lover, this is one you don't want to miss.

我姑且是玩完了。首先写在最前面，不管是建议也好还是警告也好，不要先玩妹妹线。我建议从一汐线开始，然后朔夜线，最后妹妹线，老师线可以当个小品玩玩。

一汐线给了一部分真相，但是（黑块都是剧透，下略）[spoiler]只透露了lab的情况，明日香原来的模样，所谓的是谁捅的刀子又是谁救的完全不说，最后的结局也是令我哭笑不得，说出来也无所谓，我认为是剧情最差的一条线，因为喜欢她所以为了填补她的缺陷成为了她，最后又发现喜欢上了另一个她。太烂了。[/spoiler]

朔夜线的真相更多，[spoiler]好歹给了明日香为什么想成为护士的契机，虽然很蠢就是了。揭露了是谁捅的她，虽然也很蠢就是了。牵扯到的胞姐最后喜欢上明日香我更觉得是败笔，如果朔夜线在最后人格消失，然后留下恭子和明日香两个人互相扶持但是又互相嫌弃的恶友关系是最棒的BE，结果最后搞了个轮回论就算了（你以为你是阿求噢？）还莫名其妙成了三人行，如果说一汐线是烂，那朔夜线是蠢。[/spoiler]不过话说回来，我喜欢傲娇。傲娇真棒。

妹妹线是要玩完上面两条线玩，就能得到最后的最大一块的拼图。[spoiler]无论是“只有神的力量”还是“我可不是神“都是很有趣的伏笔，我觉得真是剧情最好的一条线，虽然不配合前两条线还是不能摸出大概，这条线在真相上只是贡献了谁救下的明日香，但是无论是感情也好还是妹妹线人物性格的黑化也好，虽说还是有点突兀，不过比前两条线好太多了，这是最好吃的一条线。[/spoiler]妹妹是天使！我喜欢妹妹！妹妹使我快乐！

老师线不涉及真相，完全符合那三个人计划的一条线，[spoiler]假装初次见面，从此以后再也没有交集。其实最虐的是不知道（？）明日香在和老师交往的朔夜，遇见哭着跑过来的旧情人温柔地叫了句笨蛋，说我怎么能放下你不管。还有妹妹，“对手是她，我只能不战而败”。实在是把其他线的主角虐了个狠啊。而且明日香在老师线里异常蠢，宛若zz。甜度很足，矛盾也只是普通的少女之间的恋爱。没有任何真相。是作为失忆了的大幸家的长女所得到的结局。[/spoiler]当小品吧。唯一一条普通的线路。

总体给7/10，期望越大失望越大。元气笨蛋型的万人迷主人公我已经看腻了，还有有些剧情的时候那种扑面而来的尴尬感，“我早就想到了只是被抢先了而已”这种话，我隔着屏幕实在是太尴尬了。虽然可能会是笑点或者丰满人物性格吧，不过对于我来说我只觉得宛若一个zz。

不过毕竟是百合，又是有诚意的繁中，虽然有错字但是翻译还不差（差我也不知道反正只能听懂三四分），而且妹妹——我跟你们讲，妹妹太棒了，我爱妹妹，妹妹使我快乐！

顺便隔壁flowers和百合灵你看看人家，另外卖个私货，废都物语如果能上steam我买十份抽奖啊。

24174451.review:
[spoiler]白衣 性爱情 依存症，断句很重要，嗯嗯（托下巴[/spoiler]

工画堂去年出品的新作，年初已经入了光盘版，这次为了支援官中，又买了一份，一大早起来就要买买买还真是兴奋啊www（上班是什么，能吃吗⊙ω⊙）剧情的评测网上挺多的了，大家可以去搜一下，都写的很用心哦。

我这边主要还是点评下一下中文翻译情况吧

优点：

①翻译较好，用词规范，基本上还原了日文的风味

②美工下了功夫，汉化的比较彻底，除了一些CG中的日语外，系统图片基本上都汉化了

③汉化本身，冲着这份诚意也应该给好评

不足：

①作为视觉小说游戏，排版存在严重问题，首行标点以及句末逗号的情况很多。另外次行与首行没有左对齐，没有日文原文美观。

②少部分地方用词有误，比如“熙来人往”，正确的用词应为“熙来攘往”或者“攘往熙来”，译者要是中文水平没达到那个高度，就不要随便用较偏僻的成语，对读者也是一种负担。

③翻译有误，比如一开始就出现了“在家打滚”这个翻译，我觉得在这种简单词汇上犯错是不应该的，虽然很萌，但ごろごろ还是根据用法翻译为无所事事或者打发时间之类的才对。

④豆知识被砍了，什么鬼，笑哭.jpg

汉化质量总评：7/10 推荐，但有待加强

P.S.来自和本作有关的某作民间汉化的主翻担当，希望工画堂爸爸看到后能改善这些问题

40505155.review:
Where do I even start with this game?

If you a fan of novels with a good story, you might want to pass this up.
As you can probably see, Nurse Love Addiction insubtly hints at taking a darker turn in the endings, and as a lot of people here in comments have said, it hurt their feelings and made them sad.
I am not one of those people.

I am very mindful of fiction I try to consume, so when I saw this novel, I decided to give it a pass, since all the romance options seemed immoral and unsatisfactory. A teacher, your sister and an established couple. Talk about a dating pool, huh.
But then cute nurses got to me eventually. And what can I say? This is a very good slice of life game. As long as it tries to be slice of life. The main route is very pleasant and well-done for what it is. You get sucked into an ordinary life of a nursing student and invested in her success.

The problems start when the story takes its turn for a more serious adult one. So, when you decide on dating someone.
Here you get the main problem of the whole game, mood whiplash. Have you been under impression that this is a cute pleasant college romp? Ha-ha, we have drama! Drama, that is very, extremely poorly done and handled, hamfisted and completely tone-deaf. It seems like it's from a completely different game, spliced into this one. It doesn't mesh well and you can't even call it a twist, because of how badly it all fits together. It seems alien and wrong and not in a good horror-tropey way like in DDLC or Hatoful Boyfriend. It's drama for the sake of drama.

Not to mention, it's VERY amateurishly written. The whole thing has every trope and plot point of a bad mystery novel. Relatives-who-arent-really-relatives, secret organisations, amnesia, insidious research facilities, people returning from the dead, twins changing places, multiple personalities, convenient magical powers, brainwashing and so on and so on and so on. Every bad thing you are taught to avoid in writing mystery plots is here and is rampant and so, so obvious. 
It gets completely cringeworthy in the second part, because you are expected to be moved by new revelations, but with tone-deaf writing and pacing and completely lackluster revelations themself, it reads worse that dollar store mystery books for kids.

The game really tries to be Dark and Edgy in it's bad endings, here we have cannibalism, necrophilia and sadomasochism. Sure, it's a fairly standart thing for bad endings in adult VNs, but it turns out of complete left field. Sure, the story gets darker, but there is no foreshadowing, not even a suggestion that it getting this dark would be a logical outcome. It exists only to shock you in the end.
The whole game is a series of more and more unfortunate and badly handled revelations that exist purely for shock value and are disguised as emotional subtext.

Also, there is a thing you should think about. If getting a good end with one girl technically means that you leave all the others completely broken people with torn-apart memories, do you even deserve your happiness in the first place? If you in good conscience can decide to date your own sister or someone who's already in a relationship, you can argue that it is worth it.
But I can't. I find Asuka's choices to be completely misguided and repulsive in most cases.

And while I can say that it is a well-made game, the main thing that is supposed to be good in VNs is it's plot and writing. Here it is not good. At all. So while it may be one of the not so many yuri novels on the market, I would stronly advise you to spend your money on something else.

起頭玩建議先走甜蜜路線：大原楓老師、緒奈妹妹。

❤容易上手的是大原楓老師的路線，其他人的好感度提高一兩次無所謂，只要抓住老師出現的每一個機會。怎麼選呢？總之「愛就是替對方著想」，從這樣的方向去選擇就對了。（以成就來說，這結局我覺得是最好的）

但記得別每個都調戲到底，不然就會變的跟我一樣，花心的結果，第一起手就進入...…（花心臭了嗎，我想要後宮臭了嗎）。

39878585.review:
距離自己全通前作「白衣性戀愛症候群」已經過了好幾年，但即便前後兩作時隔四年，無論作畫，風格還是其他方面都有了很大不同，在遊玩後，我也還是能感慨道這依然是我所認知的那個「白愛」。

我想我剛說它值得遊玩就必然有其獨特的亮點
首先本作繼承了前作的大背景和世界觀，以「看護士」為主題展開，但與不同的是本作的場景從前作的「醫院」遷移到了「護校」。因此，可攻略的人物也從「前輩後輩和患者」變成了「同級生與老師」。

嚴格定義的話，本作應被分至輕百合向，但是腦缺的steam居然厚顏無恥的給它貼上了「色情內容」標籤而且有非成人警告，以至於有些不知情的外國人還問「Will this have PORN ?」。
雖然這看似不重要，但這確實讓真正喜愛這部作品的人多多少少感到荒謬與無奈。

本作也繼承前作「由淺入深」的故事架構，開篇一直到大約故事的三分之一氣氛才漸漸些許沉重。不同於《孤獨少女的百合物語》那全篇凝重的氛圍讓你只有在真正沉下心時才能夠用心體味，如果你在開始是心態比較浮躁，隨著故事的深入也能讓你自然回歸心平氣和的心態投入劇情。

如果你全路線玩通過前後兩作的話會發現這兩個遊戲有太多太多相同的地方
就比如大約在全劇情五分之二左右的地方之後的選項才真正開始影響攻略人物的路線，而且明顯到即便你不看他人的攻略也能清楚的感受到的級別。
還有就是劇情前後的伏筆（flag）在不同人物攻略是全都會得到回收，而且不會感到虎頭蛇尾。

當然有一點我想重點提出
除了稀里糊塗目標不明的瞎玩會玩出「放課後end」外，每個人物都只有一個BE（bad end）和GE（good end），這一點相比前作的設定略顯單調，而且如果你有心查看攻略的話，會發現前作的攻略複雜難度遠高於本作！
這樣的設定究竟是製作組偷懶還是經過深思熟慮後的決定？我無從判定。

整體來說，本作能攻略的四個人物中有三個人物圍繞著一個心酸的故事展開，另一個人物單獨成一個故事。
而與前作異曲同工的是，無論哪一個BE，無論攻略對象結局如何，主角都是最後被玩壞的那個。
但其中也有美中不足：
本作GE與BE的決定性選項都強制留在了最後一個選項，這就決定了如果你在通GE後是從最後一個選項存檔想再通BE的話就會感到每個BE結局都有些突兀。
通看整篇劇情，感覺就像這個遊戲就像是為那個美好的GE而創作，雖然我不是不能理解，但是否還能再為整體連續性考慮呢？

無論如何，就故事情節而言還是相當精彩
尤其是人物的心裡變化的刻劃
就比如在「看護士」這樣一個主題下，總會牽扯進一些關於生死的觀念和看法
在遊戲中對於生死本身雖沒過多糾纏，但通過心裡刻劃卻將其表達的淋漓盡致。


最後，感想很多，無奈表達能力有限，成篇最終僅此寥寥幾字…日後如欲補充還會再編輯

39877058.review: Good story, some of the hidden plot are a bit disturbing but overall it's a solid 7/10

39829735.review:
Cute, disturbing and full of great character.

You would probably expect a game named Nurse Love Addiction to only meet the first of those three things and be a shallow experience with maximum fanservice and by playing the first hour of the game that's probably the impression you're left with. However stick around and you soon realise that the characters go far beyond the stereotypes they first appear to be. The fanservice is kept to a minimum and Asuka's journey to becoming a nurse isn't fun and flirty but a path of being overworked, constant studying and failing tests. 
A good Yuri story that features voiced lines, multiple routes and a well fleshed out setting (They really did their research!). There are so few VN that exist like this. I think that should be enough to convince most people interested, but in case you aren't won yet I'm about to go in depth about what I loved so much about this game.

Characters: 10/10
Each of the five main girls has their own scars and make-ups which have brought them to where they are now. They feel human rather than 2d cut-out’s and also each one is unique from the rest. What is done well is the slow reveal, through each conversation we gain more tiny glimpses of what’s underneath and it holds back the perfect amount at the right times. The main character, Asuka who I’m counting as the fifth girl deserves a shout out. She originally seemed simple and like most MC’s a tad boring but by half way through the game she was my favourite character and the best girl! She is just so genuine and I couldn’t help love her.

Story: 9/10
The story is great and throws lots of curveballs at the reader. About half of the plot is spent with just the characters interacting, usually as a group of four or a one on one with Asuka as they navigate their daily lives as nurses. It’s very slice of lifey and probably what you’d expect from most VN. What made me enjoy these scenes was their simplicity and how the characters brought them to life, with an added boost from the voice acting. I never felt bored and as simple as I am would probably have enjoyed if that had been the whole game. The other half of the story is heavier and it really nails the drama, especially after drawing you into this world that first feels so carefree. It is by no means flawless but has tonnes of emotional moments that leave an impact. Each of the routes led in a different direction with surprisingly minimal overlap. There are two endings for each of the girls, one good and one bad that is decided (to my knowledge) by your final choice. Three of these four final choices make the player think and it’s easy to get a bad end as the right one isn’t black and white, the fourth one seemed like a freebie. The good ends are great and though the bad ones are disturbing, if you don’t mind that then I recommend seeing them as they were fantastic and maybe even my favourite part of the game. Nao was my favourite route, both ends.

Music: 7/10
I enjoyed the game’s soundtrack a great deal and it easily was a step up from just getting the job done. Sadly there is a lack of variety with maybe 10-15 different tracks at best, which over 20hrs of playtime started to become painfully obvious. What makes the issue worse is that 5-6 of these tracks take up the majority of those 20hrs. It made them become background noise and filler although it never got as bad as me actively hating whenever the song came on. The remaining tracks that aren’t played as often really makes its scenes great precisely because it’s so rare, once you reach the half-way point in the story and a new track comes on you know shits about to go down. A small gripe I had is to do with Asuka’s dreams, in these short scenes one of the more powerful songs starts to play but the narrative doesn’t have enough material to go on so you’re left to either cut the song off short or wait for a few minutes as it plays out (It really is that good) and I think it’s a shame it couldn’t have been put to better use. 

Voiceover: 10/10
The voiceover on the other hand was fantastic, each of the voice actor’s gives a great performance and overall adds much more immersion to the game. It also helps pull off many of the lines, especially the menacing ones. There is an option to select lines to play back in the pause menu which I liked and the auto play feature really shined for me, leaving just the right amount of time to read all lines which is something some games struggle with or at least struggle to be consistent with.

Yuri Level: Handholding and kissing/Hot steamy lesbian sex
The Yuri is abundant but the furthest it goes is implying sex off-screen in the good endings. A collage of all the moments you had with that route’s girl plays when you reach that ending and I was surprised by how many there were. The chemistry is real between these girls and there’s also lots of romantic moments. 10/10 to me <3 

UI:  I thought I’d briefly mention, the skip to next choice button is amazing and a great timesaver! I nearly ran out of save slots and would have if it weren’t for this bad boy. 

Criticisms and final thoughts:
As you can see from the above I absolutely loved this game and I would seriously recommend it as one of the best Yuri titles out there. I hope Shimarisu-san Team team make more games like this because this is seriously polished! The one complaint I have is about Sakuya’s route which felt so rushed. The side character introduced was horribly undeveloped, its ending also had the least to do with becoming a nurse (Although this was brought up as a major plot point in her route) and there was one moment in it that just felt jarring and broke my immersion, minimal spoilers ahead: Her and Asuka having a romantic moment as shit is going down! They both acknowledge the danger and carry on, clearly not the place! There was lots in the story left to interpret and I was a fan of this, but that was mainly for flashbacks. I felt here they needed to add another 2 or so hours of plot focused around the side character and Sakuya’s relationship and Asuka’s relationship with them both. For me it is a forgivable flaw for a game that has so much in it. This VN is seriously good.
